metadata.title: CVE-2020-1760 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Ceph Object Gateway, where it supports request sentby an anonymous user in Amazon S3. This flaw could lead to potential XSSattacks due to the lack of proper neutralization of untrusted input.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-base - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-common - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-fuse - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-grafana-dashboards - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-immutable-object-cache - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-mds - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-cephadm - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-dashboard - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-local - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-k8sevents - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-modules-core - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2

ceph-mon - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-osd - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
ceph-prometheus-alerts - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2

librgw2 - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
libsqlite3-mod-ceph - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
python3-ceph - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
python3-ceph-argparse - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
python3-ceph-common - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
python3-cephfs - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2
python3-rados - 15.2.1-0ubuntu2

No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15.2.1-0ubuntu2').
